intro: Arctotis spathuligera, commonly known as the broad-leaf arctotis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, daisy-like flowers in shades of yellow, orange, and red, which bloom from late winter to early summer. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes. Its botanical characteristics make it an attractive and hardy addition to Mediterranean and subtropical climates.
